title: Financial Performance of Berkshire Hathaway Inc Stock

content.text: Berkshire Hathaway Inc has consistently demonstrated strong revenue growth over the past few years. In 2020, the company reported revenue of $245.51 billion, a decrease of 3.3% compared to the previous year. However, this decline can be attributed to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on various industries. Despite the pandemic, Berkshire Hathaway's diverse portfolio of businesses has helped mitigate the overall revenue decline.

The earnings performance of Berkshire Hathaway Inc has been impressive. In 2020, the company reported net earnings of $35.84 billion, a substantial increase of 81.2% compared to the previous year. This growth can be primarily attributed to the increase in net investment gains and a significant reduction in losses related to derivative contracts. Berkshire Hathaway's prudent investment strategies and the strong performance of its subsidiaries have contributed to its robust earnings.

Berkshire Hathaway Inc has consistently generated strong cash flows from its operations. In 2020, the company reported operating cash flow of $52.46 billion, a decrease of 15.1% compared to the previous year. This decline is mainly attributed to the impact of the pandemic on the cash flows of certain businesses within the conglomerate. However, despite the decrease, Berkshire Hathaway's cash flow remains healthy, providing the company with the financial flexibility to pursue investment opportunities and acquisitions.

In the third quarter, Berkshire sold nearly $7 billion worth of equity securities in its portfolio.
